document.docAuthor: Bakker, Piet A. J. & Albano, Paolo G.
document.masterDocTitle: Nomenclator, geographic and stratigraphic distribution of the family Triphoridae (Mollusca: Gastropoda)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Nomenclator, geographic and stratigraphic distribution of the family Triphoridae (Mollusca: Gastropoda)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Remarks. The genus
Triphoris
is of feminine gender, therefore the name should be
Triphoris cingulata
.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Triforis cingulifera Pease, 1861
—
Martens & Langkavel 1871: 38
, pl. 2, fig. 8.

Triforis cinguliferus Pease, 1861
—
Tryon 1887: 186
, pl. 39, fig. 43.

Notosinister cinguliferus ( Pease, 1861 )
—
Kosuge 1962b: 88
, pl. 9, fig. 6.

Notosinister cingulifera ( Pease, 1861 )
—
Habe 1964: 45
, pl. 13, fig. 17.

Mastonia cingulifera ( Pease, 1861 )
—
Habe & Kosuge 1966: 105
, pl. 41, fig. 11.

Triphora ( Mastonia ) cingulifera Pease, 1861
—

, pl. 12, fig. 13.

Mesophora cingulifera ( Pease, 1861 )
—

, fig. 103.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type material.
NHMUK 1962812 , lectotype
.
NHMUK 196813 ,
MCZ 50056
,
MCZ 50076
,
MCZ 73737
and
MCZ 161283 , paralectotypes
.
ANSP 59274 , paralectotype
.
Distribution. China Sea ( Zongguo & Mao 2012 ), French Polynesia ( Tröndle & Boutet 2009 ), Hawaii ( Pease 1861 ;

Remarks. Lectotype designation by Kay (1965) . The record by Kurozumi & Asakura (1994) was listed as
Iniforis cingulata (Pease)
, but this is probably a misspelling.
